episode_summary: This episode features discussions on historical events and quirky facts, including King Stephen's rise to the throne due to a shipwreck, sea turtles' long-standing dining habits, the prevalence of street musicians in 19th century London, and a bungled glue theft in Brazil.

facts.fact: My fact is that King Stephen owed his throne to food poisoning or, you know, the shit.
My fact is that sea turtles have been going to the same restaurant for 3,000 years.
Okay, my fact this week is that in 1861, there was one street musician for every ten streets in London.
My fact is that in 1993, a man in Brazil who robbed a factory of its glue was arrested 36 hours later, still in the factory he was robbing, because he was stuck to the glue he was stealing.
